metadata.title: How to Export YouTube Analytics 2025: Download Your Data
metadata.description: Export YouTube analytics data. Download reports and track performance externally.

hero.headline: How to Export YouTube Analytics
hero.subheadline: Download your data. Analyze beyond YouTube Studio.

sections.content: YouTube Studio provides data, but sometimes you need it outside the platform—for spreadsheets, custom analysis, reports to sponsors, or long-term tracking. Exporting analytics lets you manipulate data freely and maintain records YouTube might not keep forever.

sections.title: Exporting Analytics
content: Click Advanced Mode for more options
File downloads or opens in Sheets

sections.title: Export Tips
content: CSV for Excel or database import

sections.title: Export Checklist
content: Using Advanced Mode for full data?

faq.question: What data can I export?
faq.answer: Most analytics data exportable—views, watch time, subscribers, revenue (if monetized), traffic sources, demographics, and more. Advanced Mode reveals additional breakdowns. Some real-time data not available.

faq.question: Google Sheets or CSV?
faq.answer: Google Sheets for immediate cloud access and collaboration. CSV for local storage, Excel use, or database import. Both contain same data. Choose based on your workflow.

faq.question: How far back can I export?
faq.answer: Data available from channel creation. Some metrics have limited historical depth. Lifetime view useful for long-term. Export regularly to ensure you have records.

faq.question: Can I automate exports?
faq.answer: Not natively in YouTube Studio. YouTube Analytics API allows programmatic access for developers. Third-party tools can automate. Manual export simple for most creators.
